#summary validatesExclusionOf(property,list[message,when,allowBlank])
#labels api,0.9

*Category*:

[ModelInitializationFunctions Model Initialization Functions]

*Description*:

Validates that the value of the specified property does not exist in the supplied list.

*Return Type*:

Void

*History*:

-

*Parameters*:

|| *Name* || *Type* || *Required* || *Default* || *Description* ||
|| *property* || string || true || - || Name of the property to validate ||
|| *list* || string || true || - || List of values that should not be allowed ||
|| *message* || string || false ||   || Supply a custom error message here to override the built-in one ||
|| *when* || string || false || onSave || Pass in `onCreate` or `onUpdate` to limit when this validation occurs (by default validation it will occur on both create and update, i.e. `onSave`) ||
|| *allowBlank* || boolean || false || false || If set to `true`, validation will be skipped if the value of the property is blank. ||

*Examples*:

{{{
<!--- in models/User.cfc --->
<cffunction name="init">
  <cfset validatesExclusionOf(property="coolLanguage", list="php,fortran", message="Haha, you can't be serious, try again please.")>
</cffunction>
}}}
